---
title: "openapi_v3.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines an OpenAPI 3.0.0 specification for a simple Petstore API. It outlines the structure, endpoints, request/response formats, and data models for a pet management system, including operations to list, create, and retrieve pet information.

## API/Interface Reference
| Endpoint | Method | Request | Response | Description |
|:---------|:-------|:--------|:---------|:------------|
| /pets | GET | Query param: limit (optional) | 200: Paged array of pets, default: Error | List all pets |
| /pets | POST | Pet object in request body | 201: Null response, default: Error | Create a pet |
| /pets/{petId} | GET | Path param: petId | 200: Pet object, default: Error | Get info for a specific pet |

## Components
### Schemas
1. Pet
   - Type: object
   - Required fields: id, name
   - Properties:
     - id: integer (int64)
     - name: string
     - tag: string (optional)

2. Pets
   - Type: array
   - Max items: 100
   - Items: Pet objects

3. Error
   - Type: object
   - Required fields: code, message
   - Properties:
     - code: integer (int32)
     - message: string

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| openapi | string | "3.0.0" | OpenAPI specification version |
| info.version | string | "1.0.0" | API version |
| info.title | string | "Swagger Petstore" | API title |
| info.license.name | string | "MIT" | License type |
| servers[0].url | string | "http://petstore.swagger.io/v1" | Base URL for the API |

## Error Handling
The API defines a default error response for all endpoints, using the Error schema. This provides a consistent error format across the API, including an error code and message.

## Dependencies
This OpenAPI specification doesn't explicitly list external dependencies, as it's a self-contained definition of the API structure and behavior.
